result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement and DNA expungement option.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Continue to engage in programming currently in, and follow any recommendations.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Artis.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.    Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.  Court found that the defendant entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court found that a factual basis exists.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation with conditions.  Continue to engage in programming.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and comply recommendations.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Seek and maintain employment.  Victim spoke.  Attorney Artis requests that the defendant be able to apply for early discharge.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 2 years probation concurrent.   Continue to engage in programming currently on,  and follow the recommendations.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, except for employment purposes only.  AODA and comply recommendations.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Seek and maintain employment. CC, including domestic abuse surcharge.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement in 15CM112.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-20-2015 10:30 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Artis.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he is pleading to.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1.  Dismiss and read in other counts.  Concurrent probation with same conditions as 14CM297.  Plea/sentencing adjourned to 7/20/15 at 10:30 am.
